alert.note: Alert for Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Cumberland (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cumberland and Cape May Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Bivalve to near North Cape May. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cape May, North Wildwood, Wildwood Crest, Woodbine, Sea Isle City, Avalon, West Cape May, Stone Harbor, Corbin City, Cape May Court House, Scotch Bonnet, Seaville, Dennisville, Eldora, North Cape May, Belleplain Forest, Diamond Beach, Green Creek, Goshen and Rio Grande. This includes Garden State Parkway between mile markers 0 and 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern New Jersey. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Atlantic Coastal Cape May; Cape May; Cumberland
